column5: You are like me...i find ice fishing the complete opposite of open water. Open water season give me stormy cloudy weather any day. As long as it‚Äôs not a ‚Äúcold‚Äù storm where it rains for days. Unsettled stormy weather is the best. Meanwhile ice fishing, give me the sunniest calmest blue bird day you can find and I‚Äôll always catch more fish.

Wonder if anyone is out today, wind is brutal up by me. I was thinking about going out but not now. Seems like the next week is going to be good for making ice, but the wind is still supposed to be strong most of the week.
same thing here in southeastern Ontario, winds southwest 40 gusting to 70........üòÆ
You should see the squalls going on at my parents place. It‚Äôs basically a full blown blizzard
Yesterday  https://www.facebook.com/fatalforceoutfitters/videos/3805961032776572/
Wow, that's crazy! floating sheets everywhere.
and probably sheets in that guy's floater suit too............üòâ
Those are racing stripes...¬† Stripes made racing to shore...
I can‚Äôt seem to share the link. ????

Ya, his buddy that was on the other sled hung onto him for 40 min til rescue arrived. Now that is a true friend. https://www.cp24.com/news/man-airlifted-to-hospital-in-critical-condition-after-falling-through-ice-on-lake-simcoe-1.5298513  Just back and have to say,ice is so scetchy still. On a spot that has been frozen over 2 weeks now. only 4". Heard BBP broke up as well and went out to the main lake. High winds today. 20 km with gusts of 50km. Still managed to get the hub up and down with ease.
By yourself? And did the whities come out to play? Doug
Yup all by my fat little self Doug . Marked 2 fish, no hook ups .
Was out today from 7th line of innisfil area. Caught a bunch of decent perch and a few jumbos for breakfast tomorrow. 5-6 inches of good ice. Great day to be on the ice.

Cant save these cheap morons from themselves lmaooo youd have to be nuts to even take a skidoo on simcoe never mind a car. Parry sound just got safe for snowmobiles, never mind a bloody car lmao. as my buddy jake says, the fishing regulations say perch season starts on simcoe when some moron puts their minivan through the ice! Lmaooo
But did you catch any fish?  	Doug
Ya especially when most guys are spudding their way out like I will tomorrow or later during the week.
There were a few dinks around but nothing worth catching  and the dinks ¬†parked their cars on the ice
There is a video going around that the ice is breaking up into large football sized chunks around brechin area up that way.
Salt dock had open water 3 days ago.¬† PS isn't even going to freeze over this year me thinks.
Oh god don‚Äôt try to access the sound from parry sound side, if there is ice it only showed up two days ago. Where I was fishing you could see open water Saturday
I‚Äôm itchin to go ice fishin. ¬†Prepping my ice stuff now. ¬†Hoping for some whities, lakers and burbot ü§û

Brechin is a long ways from cooks bay though.  I went out of PB and the ice was good 8-10‚Äù good black ice. Lots of huts out.  caught zero fish though. First time ever being skunked on simcoe . I wasn‚Äôt brave enough to venture to far from the travelled areas though. i felt the ice move below me and almost knocked me over. It was the weirdest feeling. I‚Äôve never had that ever happen before. It was actually kind of scary. Because you know somewhere there‚Äôs now a pressure crack that wasn‚Äôt there.

Ya I know brechin is a long way from cooks, I didn‚Äôt say it was close. This is a Simcoe¬†ice post lol. However being a weird weather year there is sketchy ice everywhere. Looks like I have about 3-4 inches in the bay I‚Äôm in around 7th line of Innisfil.
do people really go out there on4 inches of ice?

Yes, I‚Äôm comfortable on 3-4 inches of ice, but I have a float suit on and picks,¬†that‚Äôs the bare minimum for me. A lot of guys go out on 1-2 ish. That‚Äôs nuts to me. Was out today, man it was insanely windy had to hold down the hut whilst fishing. Caught a bunch of perch.
I am a newfie. LOL Nice on the perch catching .

ya I tested ice strength earlier this year...went 30 feet out (about 3 feet of water). Ice was around 1.5 inches and I could hit through it with one hit of spud bar. I did walk around for a bit (5 minutes) and never went through...which actually surprised me. I expect it was only a matter of time...but since I did not want a wet boot I kept my stay short. This was possibly the first time I have used my 25 year old spud bar....every other year I have just waited until I knew it was safe. But for those who venture out early, a¬†spud bar would be a very valuable tool. Not sure how many hits before you would consider the ice safe...but it isn't one!

Went out of Virginia Beach yesterday, got a bunch of the kids out for a day on the hard water. Drilled through mostly 11‚Äù of black ice, one spot had 8‚Äù. First time ever getting skunked perch fish on Simcoe. Was really hoping for a good day with the kids. This was the third time I have taken my little guy out and the third time we have been skunked, not good

lol you would be shocked at what you can walk around on when it comes to ice. Last year when i rescued my dog i was walking on <1" and it was shattering underneath my boots as i walked. When i finally went through i was basically on "puddle ice" like im talking less than a quarter of an inch. So little that I dont specifically remember there even being ice chunks from me falling through. Ive also walked on what I wouldnt even call ice..it was more like 8 inches of heavy snow that had piled up on a skim of ice. Im talking so bad that if you stood your spud up on it and went through never mind needed to hit or break anything. That time though I was specifically doing it to see if I would fall through. I was 40 yards from my house wearing a rope, floater and with picks in hand ready to fall in. Crazily i didnt. We then decided that we would fish it. We set tip ups and you couldnt run to them because your feet would go through, you had to shuffle your way to them. When you sat in you chair if you sat too hard the legs went through. Youd also slowly sink as you sat jigging. Heres the point in all of this, the guys that fish two inches of ice on simcoe that are actually prepared with the right equipment are far safer than the guy that comes to the lake totally unprepared to fall in because he punches a hole and sees 6+ inches of ice. Ice is 100% unpredictable, it cracks, currents push water up, it does all sorts of stuff meaning that its totally unpredictable and inconsistent. The only way to be on it¬†safely is assume you are going to fall through basically no matter what. To me the 250+lb 50+ year old guy that doesnt wear a floater or carry picks that goes out on 5-6 inches is way crazier than the 20 year old 180lb guy thats carrying a spud, wearing a floater and carrying picks. Ill ask the 50+ crowd here, how many of you are confident that you can do a body weight pull up?

Plenty of good ice, even on whitefish water, and yeah I‚Äôve been. ¬†If you don‚Äôt know don‚Äôt go. ¬†It‚Äôs not the best ice year but there‚Äôs fishable ice. ¬†Every section of the lake will make ice in varying degrees. ¬†Some will be downright unsafe. ¬†In other areas you can run a sled or wheeler. ¬†But yeah, if this is your first rodeo, go with an operator and fish for perch!

I could...but I am only 51 and weigh 175. Not the biggest guy and not tooo old yet. Plus I bought a weight set a couple years ago for my 4 sons. Since they are too lazy to use it, and I am too Dutch to allow this purchase to be a waste of money, I do a few workouts¬†myself each week. If i go through it would likely be the shock to my heart that gets me rather than the inability to get out!

I wish I was 50 again!¬† I don't know how many chin-ups I can do any more, haven't tried in a long time.¬† But I do wear a floater suit and carry picks AND a spud bar. BTW I am guessing there are a lot of 50 year old men who are fitter than 25 year old couch potatoes who spend their time playing with their phones and eating junk food.¬† Just sayin'.....üòâ Doug

I bring this up because I am conscious of the fact that if my 68 year old father with a bad shoulder goes in...I‚Äôm not certain he‚Äôd get out. Wasn‚Äôt there a guy a few years ago that was 300lbs and went in with a floater and just couldn‚Äôt manage to get himself out? Good god I couldn‚Äôt imagine going that way...wow
Very true, the float suits might give people a false sense of security, you still have to be able pull yourself out if you go in.

Once you get to a certain age you tend to do stupid things in groups greater than one.¬† When we travel possibly suspect ice, its in a group, with throw lines, spuds and floatation gear.¬† The average age is 50, but we could still help a brother out.¬† There will come a time that I no longer do these things.

I am 75, I don't even bother with a floater suit any more, I dont walk on 4" of ice, carry ice picks or a spud. When I want to go ice fishing now I¬† pay my $60.00, park on shore, get transported to and from a nice warm clean hut by knowledgable staff and just enjoy the dayüòä. Oh, and here is yesterday's catch and several nice jumbos were released to fight another day.
Nice haul Cliff. Did better then I. Two of us met on Scugog to chase gills and crappie, and neither of us brought fish home. Beauty day to be out though.

Sorry to hear you didn't catch a mess of fish. The bite was slow but steady, we brought home 25 including one burbot and easly released that many. We did keep 5 smaller fish that were badly hooked and we figured they would probably die anyway. We were on 8-10" of ice in about 30 fow. We are going back out again tomorrow but with this cold front coming in I am thinking it might be a little slower.
With all this cold weather coming in I was just wondering if we are going to be able to get out for some jumbo perch in the next week or so. Does anyone have any info on ice conditions?
Cooks bay you can in spots. Virginia Beach people are getting out. ¬†I have not heard any reports from Beaverton yet and I have not heard if hut rentals have any out yet.
Thanks Terry

They are walking out in Gilford and Virginia. Some sleds and ATV's out of Glenwoods Very south and east end of Cooks Bay They are out in Port Bolster¬† Casey's is renting huts. Not sure about Beaverton.
Thanks!
Up by me just north of 7th line of Innisfil, we just froze over 2-3 days ago. I'm thinking by the weekend I can take a venture out with the spud bar.
Be careful, I would hate to find out the ice isn't safe on the news üòä
Just saw a clip on social media of someone out in 120fow with two inches of ice.

J's hut rental from Lefroy there made a video and it was posted on Facebook, that he has seen quite a few people walk out with no float suit or safety gear, it's still really sketchy around there. 1-2 inches in random spots. I won't go out on less then 3 ish. This year I think there's a lot of Newbies that are taking a risk because there isn't much else to do. Hopefully no more tragedies this season.
That‚Äôs crazy!
He just updated saying it wasn‚Äôt safe because he had to move every twenty minutes because he was sinking!
People are legit crack heads.
Looking to win a Darwin award............which it would appear he richly deserves.............

This snow is not gonna help at all either, damn insulator. Would have made a fair bit of ice over the next couple days, getting cold. I think I'll still be starting my hockey rink down at the lake this weekend.
Anyone looked at Innisfil beach park yet?

Yup Tuesday¬†¬†there was a few inches near shore. ¬† ¬† About 30 steps out ¬†about an inch and a half. Spud went through with an easy hit. ¬†Today I heard a few guys were out from the ninth line but not very far out. I would think there will be some walking out by Saturday
Thanks Terry!
Not safe enough for me yet
No way I‚Äôd go out on 2 lol, man people are risking a lot for a fish.

Lots of ice for walking from Monto Reno marina south to gilford In some¬†of places there were machines on the ice but I spudded and found the ice too inconsistent for my bike. And saw some slush fields too

Got my rink started today and did a flood, I have 3 inches of ice right near shore, I can see a few guys out off the point near the 7th line and a few farther north, can't be on too much ice... sketchy. Maybe another week for me.
Barrie news tonight. Cars parked on near shore ice went through on Cooks Bay: https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/two-minivans-break-through-ice-on-cook-s-bay-1.5289102
Yep, smart people.
Happens every year, unfortunately
Yeah I was out fishing from there and couldn‚Äôt believe they were parking on the ice there I could only get out to 14 ft depth¬†with my side by side
